snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio has vowed to set a minimum wage for New York City, but state legislators say the plan has no chance of succeeding this year.
abstract: Rachel L Swarns The Working Life column notes that New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio had vowed to create a city minimum wage, but has since moved campaign to backburner in order to focus on education goals like universal prekindergarten; describes experience of Roberto Guzman, Harlem resident who is barely able to feed his family on his minimum wage salary of $8 an hour.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio has vowed to set a minimum wage for New York City, but state legislators say the plan has no chance of succeeding this year.

headline.main: Among de Blasio’s Priorities, Minimum Wage Waits Behind Pre-K
headline.print_headline: Among de Blasio’s Priorities, Minimum Wage Waits Behind Pre-K
